parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the final drive bearing can cause the rear wheel to wobble significantly, leading to a loss of control and potentially causing an accident. The failure can also cause oil to leak onto the rear tire, making it slippery and increasing the risk of a crash.
symptoms: Rear tire becomes oil-covered and slick
excessive movement in the rear wheel
rear tire is oil-soaked from the seal failure
loud grinding or knocking noise from the rear end.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Clutch and Transmission Input Shaft Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the clutch and transmission input shaft can cause the motorcycle to lose forward drive, leaving the rider stranded and potentially causing an accident.
symptoms: Clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
clutch disk splines stripped
transmission input shaft splines worn
loss of drive to the rear wheel
grinding or knocking noise from the transmission.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel line quick disconnects can cause fuel leaks, which can lead to a high risk of fire, potentially resulting in serious injury or death.
symptoms: Fuel leaks
fuel smell
empty fuel tank
loss of fuel over time
engine or exhaust damage.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel pump can cause the motorcycle to stall or lose power, potentially leading to accidents or leaving the rider stranded in traffic.
symptoms: The motorcycle stalls or loses power
the engine dies while riding
the motorcycle is unable to maintain speed.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel quick disconnect can cause fuel leaks, which can lead to fires, accidents, or other safety hazards.
symptoms: Fuel leaks from the quick disconnect
small drops of fuel leak from the line
fuel pours from the line when disconnected.
